title: Graeme Souness praises Newcastle debutant Matty Longstaff after scoring winner vs Manchester United
text:
Graeme Souness has hailed man of the moment Matty Longstaff after the Newcastle youngster scored the winner over Manchester United on his Premier League debut.

Newcastle ran out 1-0 victors over Manchester United on Sunday at St James Park and former Liverpool midfielder Souness was left very impressed by what he saw of 19-year-old Longstaff.

The Scotsman told Sky Sports: 'He’s a clean striker of the ball. He belonged out there and he looked confident from the first touch of the ball. Over the 90 minutes, do debuts get better than that?'

Matty Longstaff said he was 'over the moon' after his debut winner over Manchester United

Graeme Souness applauded the impact of the Newcastle star after stepping onto the big stage

Longstaff celebrated wildly at St James Park where he has come through the Toon academy

Longstaff was taken aback by his instant impact and remarked on how his sudden changing of fortunes felt so surreal, especially as he was only told he would be playing on Saturday (the day before the game).

'I’m a bit in awe to be honest,' he commented. 'You go to bed dreaming of this and you never think it's going to happen.

'For it to happen, I'm over the moon. I’m a bit speechless.'

After hitting the crossbar in the first half, Longstaff's winner came in the 72nd minute as the ginger-haired midfielder struck home a fierce low strike from just outside the box.

Longstaff's 20-yard strike has relieved some of the pressure on Newcastle boss Steve Bruce

He was joined in the Newcastle midfield by older brother Sean Longstaff as Newcastle recorded just their second league win of the season.

'I'm over the moon for him,"Sean said. "If I'm being honest, he's been unlucky to be out of the team. But today he's been a breath of fresh air.

'It was great, you look how lively he is, he gets around the pitch and makes my job much easier.

'Usually he's bouncing around the house but last night he was the quietest I've ever seen him. He was outstanding and deserves all the credit he's going to get.'

The result leaves Manchester United just two points above the relegation zone on eight points - the Red Devils' lowest points tally since 1989-90.
